#cdd_id	align_files	tree_files	cluster_files	cluster_nb_reads_files	pairwise_files	description	full_description
pfam00286	pfam00286_Flexi_CP/pfam00286_w_qry_aligned.fasta	pfam00286_Flexi_CP/pfam00286_Flexi_CP.tree.nwx.png	pfam00286_Flexi_CP/clusters.csv	pfam00286_Flexi_CP/cluster_nb_reads.csv	pfam00286_Flexi_CP/identity_matrix.csv	Flexi_CP	pfam00286, Flexi_CP, Viral coat protein.  Family includes coat proteins from Potexviruses and carlaviruses.
pfam00680	pfam00680_RdRP_1/pfam00680_w_qry_aligned.fasta	pfam00680_RdRP_1/pfam00680_RdRP_1.tree.nwx.png	pfam00680_RdRP_1/clusters.csv	pfam00680_RdRP_1/cluster_nb_reads.csv	pfam00680_RdRP_1/identity_matrix.csv	RdRP_1	pfam00680, RdRP_1, RNA dependent RNA polymerase.  
pfam00978	pfam00978_RdRP_2/pfam00978_w_qry_aligned.fasta	pfam00978_RdRP_2/pfam00978_RdRP_2.tree.nwx.png	pfam00978_RdRP_2/clusters.csv	pfam00978_RdRP_2/cluster_nb_reads.csv	pfam00978_RdRP_2/identity_matrix.csv	RdRP_2	pfam00978, RdRP_2, RNA dependent RNA polymerase.  This family may represent an RNA dependent RNA polymerase. The family also contains the following proteins: 2A protein from bromoviruses putative RNA dependent RNA polymerase from tobamoviruses Non structural polyprotein from togaviruses.
pfam01443	pfam01443_Viral_helicase1/pfam01443_w_qry_aligned.fasta	pfam01443_Viral_helicase1/pfam01443_Viral_helicase1.tree.nwx.png	pfam01443_Viral_helicase1/clusters.csv	pfam01443_Viral_helicase1/cluster_nb_reads.csv	pfam01443_Viral_helicase1/identity_matrix.csv	Viral_helicase1	pfam01443, Viral_helicase1, Viral (Superfamily 1) RNA helicase.  Helicase activity for this family has been demonstrated and NTPase activity. This helicase has multiple roles at different stages of viral RNA replication, as dissected by mutational analysis.
pfam01660	pfam01660_Vmethyltransf/pfam01660_w_qry_aligned.fasta	pfam01660_Vmethyltransf/pfam01660_Vmethyltransf.tree.nwx.png	pfam01660_Vmethyltransf/clusters.csv	pfam01660_Vmethyltransf/cluster_nb_reads.csv	pfam01660_Vmethyltransf/identity_matrix.csv	Vmethyltransf	pfam01660, Vmethyltransf, Viral methyltransferase.  This RNA methyltransferase domain is found in a wide range of ssRNA viruses, including Hordei-, Tobra-, Tobamo-, Bromo-, Clostero- and Caliciviruses. This methyltransferase is involved in mRNA capping. Capping of mRNA enhances its stability. This usually occurs in the nucleus. Therefore, many viruses that replicate in the cytoplasm encode their own. This is a specific guanine-7-methyltransferase domain involved in viral mRNA cap0 synthesis. Specificity for guanine 7 position is shown by NMR in and in vivo role in cap synthesis. Based on secondary structure prediction, the basic fold is believed to be similar to the common AdoMet-dependent methyltransferase fold. A curious feature of this methyltransferase domain is that it together with flanking sequences seems to have guanylyltransferase activity coupled to the methyltransferase activity. The domain is found throughout the so-called Alphavirus superfamily, (including alphaviruses and several other groups). It forms the defining, unique feature of this superfamily.
pfam02123	pfam02123_RdRP_4/pfam02123_w_qry_aligned.fasta	pfam02123_RdRP_4/pfam02123_RdRP_4.tree.nwx.png	pfam02123_RdRP_4/clusters.csv	pfam02123_RdRP_4/cluster_nb_reads.csv	pfam02123_RdRP_4/identity_matrix.csv	RdRP_4	pfam02123, RdRP_4, Viral RNA-directed RNA-polymerase.  This family includes RNA-dependent RNA polymerase proteins (RdRPs) from Luteovirus, Totivirus and Rotavirus.
pfam03225	pfam03225_Viral_Hsp90/pfam03225_w_qry_aligned.fasta	pfam03225_Viral_Hsp90/pfam03225_Viral_Hsp90.tree.nwx.png	pfam03225_Viral_Hsp90/clusters.csv	pfam03225_Viral_Hsp90/cluster_nb_reads.csv	pfam03225_Viral_Hsp90/identity_matrix.csv	Viral_Hsp90	pfam03225, Viral_Hsp90, Viral heat shock protein Hsp90 homologue.  
pfam05892	pfam05892_Tricho_coat/pfam05892_w_qry_aligned.fasta	pfam05892_Tricho_coat/pfam05892_Tricho_coat.tree.nwx.png	pfam05892_Tricho_coat/clusters.csv	pfam05892_Tricho_coat/cluster_nb_reads.csv	pfam05892_Tricho_coat/identity_matrix.csv	Tricho_coat	pfam05892, Tricho_coat, Trichovirus coat protein.  This family consists of several coat proteins which are specific to the ssRNA positive-strand, no DNA stage viruses such as the Trichovirus and Vitivirus.
pfam05919	pfam05919_Mitovir_RNA_pol/pfam05919_w_qry_aligned.fasta	pfam05919_Mitovir_RNA_pol/pfam05919_Mitovir_RNA_pol.tree.nwx.png	pfam05919_Mitovir_RNA_pol/clusters.csv	pfam05919_Mitovir_RNA_pol/cluster_nb_reads.csv	pfam05919_Mitovir_RNA_pol/identity_matrix.csv	Mitovir_RNA_pol	pfam05919, Mitovir_RNA_pol, Mitovirus RNA-dependent RNA polymerase.  This family consists of several Mitovirus RNA-dependent RNA polymerase proteins. The family also contains fragment matches in the mitochondria of Arabidopsis thaliana.
